results.title: Eight or nine in the morning
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An insight into China’s new educational ideas - old traditions have been abandoned, and education today is non-competitive, with exams rarely given. Looks at the status of intellectuals and touches on background philosophy since the revolution. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The People's communes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Uses scenes from three communes in different parts of China to show the range of work and activities carried on in communes. However, a clear picture of people’s rules within these communes and the structural organisation is not shown.

results.title: The People's army
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An inside picture of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army - as well as being a fighting force, the army, in contrast to western peacetime armies, uses its personnel in “civilian” activities and is a training ground for politics, engineering and agriculture. Photographed, written and narrated by Felix Greene.

results.title: Self reliance
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene, Felix Greene Films and World Entertainers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”

Covers the idea of China becoming self reliant in almost every aspect, including food, conservation of resources and industry at village levels. Shows the life style of industrial workers, housing developments, committees and neighbourhood workshops for housewives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Felix Greene, Felix Greene Films and World Entertainers

results.title: Eight minutes to midnight
results.creator_credit: Mary Benjamin and Fund for Theatre and Film
results.brief_description: A portrait of Dr Helen Caldicott, Australian-born but US-based paediatrician and author. Describes her struggle to inform and arouse the public in the USA and Australia to the medical dangers of a nuclear attack. Includes scenes of 1979 return to Australia on a tour to promote her book “Nuclear Madness”; Today Tonight interview, and discussions with Government and other radio interviews. We also see Dr Caldicott in the Northern Territory where she meets with union officials and presents her case against uranium mining. Co-director and cinematographer: Boyd Estus. “New Mexican Sundown” written and performed by Lisa Gilkyson. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Benjamin and Fund for Theatre and Film

results.title: Effective Questioning in a Classroom Discussion(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Oyston and University of Lancaster (Microteaching Research Unit)
results.brief_description: The course is essentially self instructional and designed to encourage self diagnosis. It aims to produce measurable improvements in questioning techniques and thus to reduce teacher talk and increase pupil participation

results.title: Effective and creative writing: reaching your reader
results.brief_description: An examination of how to appeal to the readers’ senses; how to create dynamic rather than static descriptions; instead of describing emotions for readers, how to make them feel those emotions. A dlightful film, rich in imagery and examples.

results.title: Educational smorgasbord (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Educational smorgasbord operates in northern NSW and is organised by an ex-primary headmaster. Examines issues in community education - participation, funding, accountability.
